intro: Fimbristylis juncea var. polytrichoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flatsedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically found in wet or seasonally flooded habitats. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in marshy areas or along the edges of water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
